channel.title: Current team members on Cooperstone Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Current team members on Cooperstone Lab

item.title: Jordan (JL) Hartman
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Horticulture and Crop Science Years in the lab: 2019-present Research focus: Understanding the chemical basis of bitterness from high alkaloid tomatoes. Pubs: Dzakovich MP, Hartman JL, Cooperstone JL. A high-throughput extraction and analysis method for steroidal glycoalkaloids in tomato. Front Plant Sci, 2020;11:767. https://doi.org/10.3389/fpls.2020.00767 - Also published a preprint on bioRxiv. Background: B.S. Biology, Wingate University, M.S. Horticultural Science, North Carolina State University Hometown: Salisbury, NC Non-work interests: Contact: hartman dot 635 at osu dot edu

item.title: Maria Sholola
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Food Science & Technology Years in the lab: 2020-present Research focus: Understanding absorption, metabolism, and bioactivity of tomato and soy phytochemicals. Background: B.S. Chemistry, Loyola University, Chicago, IL Hometown: Chicago, IL, USA Non-work interests: dancing (urban, Afrobeats, and more recently ballet), running and biking scenic routes (hasn’t found one that tops Chicago’s lakefront trail yet), and traveling. Contact: sholola dot one at osu dot edu Links: Google scholar profile Twitter

item.title: Daniel Quiroz Moreno
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Horticulture and Crop Science Years in the lab: 2021-present Research focus: Multi-omic integration for crop nutritional improvement, with a focus on developing informatic tools. Background: B.S. Biotechnology, Ikiam University, Tena, Ecuador Hometown: Riobamba, Ecuador Non-work interests: Contact: quirozmoreno dot 1 at osu dot edu Links: Google scholar profile Twitter Github

item.title: Daniel Do
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Food Science and Technology Years in the lab: 2021-present Research focus: Elucidating the in vivo relevance of tomato steroidal alkaloids: an understanding of their absorption, metabolism, accumulation, and bioefficacy Background: B.S. Chemistry, Stockton University, Galloway, NJ Hometown: Galloway, NJ, USA Non-work interests: Contact: do dot 226 at osu dot edu

item.title: Lydia Balogh
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Horticulture and Crop Science Years in the lab: 2022-present Research focus: Apple improvement using genomics, metabolomics, and sensory science Background: B.S. Biology, minor in English Language and Literature, University of Western Ontario, Canada Hometown: London, Ontario, Canada Non-work interests: Contact: balogh dot 67 at osu dot edu Links: Twitter

item.title: Aaron Wiedemer
item.description: Degree: Ph.D. Program: Food Science & Technology Years in the lab: 2022-present Research focus: Background: B.S. Food Science, minor Jazz Performance, Penn State University, University Park, PA Hometown: Chatham, NJ, USA Non-work interests: Contact: wiedemer dot 7 at osu dot edu Links: Google scholar profile Twitter

item.title: Giovana Mercali, Ph.D.
item.description: Program: Visiting Professor, Food Science & Technology Years in the lab: 2023 Research focus: Applying metabolomics to assess food quality after novel food processing technologies Google scholar Background: B.S. Food Engineering, M.S. Chemical Engineering, Ph.D. Chemical Engineering, all from Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul, Porto Alegre, Brazil. Currently Assistant Professor, Food Science, Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul, Porto Alegre, Brazil Hometown: Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil Non-work interests: Brazilian soccer (especially Grêmio Foot-Ball Porto Alegrense, the best team of southern Brazil), meditation and mindfulness, exploring nature (parks, beaches, mountains) Contact: mercali dot 1 at osu dot edu

item.title: Nacho (Cooperstone)
item.description: Degree: Working on basic obedience Years in the lab: 2018-present Areas of focus: Snoring during Zooms, rolling around in the dirt after a bath, eating cheese. Hometown: Columbus, OH Interests: splooting, taking walks as long as its not too hot, cheese
